column4: confused about adding users and groups. I wanted to add user 'radio' to group 'audio'. How would I do this? What ended up happening is that I added user 'radio' to group 'radio.' How do I undo this?
sudo adduser radio audio
and "sudo deluser radio radio"
I tried that first, and I got adduser: The user `radio' does not exist.
does user 'radio' exist?
I tried the deluser commmand and it is telling me I cannot remove the user from his/her primary group...
ok.  user radio is in group radio by default.
you don't need to remove it
like user whyameye is in group whyameye by default, too
I don't know either.  did you create the user first, then try to add them to the group?  if you didn't create the user first, that'll be whyt.
yes I didn't create the user first. So how would I have done that, just so I know?
just "sudo adduser radio"
or use the gui, of course...
so I should have typed "sudo adduser radio" then typed "sudo adduser radio audio"?
that's about the size of it, yes.
try it now with "radio2" instead of "radio" for practice :)
thanks I just tried with radio2 and it worked great! Thanks!
now you can "man deluser" to find out how to get rid of 'radio2' and his home directory in a single command...
sudo deluser radio2 will leave his home directory by default
oops, I already did "sudo deluser radio2." I can just delete the home directory manually?
sure
done! Thanks!
deluser has an option to make a backup on the home dir before deleting it too
